revised_title: Incombustible Cloth: Historical Accounts and Scientific Analysis
tldr: This article discusses the historical accounts and scientific analysis of the incombustible linen cloth, also known as Amiantus. The author provides various testimonies from ancient authors and their experiences with the material, which was believed to be fire-resistant. The author also explores the different names and qualities of the material, as well as its origins and uses. The incombustible linen cloth was highly valued for its unique properties and was used in various cultures for various purposes, such as funeral shrouds and fire-resistant materials.
